page.title: 05 MEMORIES OF GREAT SUTTON
page.content: Two ladies have spoken about Great Sutton's development during the{last {sixty years. Mrs.Price}remembers the village as a farming community.{Mrs. {Foxhall}was born on Mount Farm in 1923. She remembers taking the cows down the lane to the fields and milking them in the "shippons" (cowsheds). There were no flats or houses, but two pubs,the{White Swan {and the Bull's Head.}The village school was called "Eleanor school". If you did anything naughty either inside or outside school you would be caned. In{1934 the by-pass was built.}Now there are houses and roads where there used to be fields. Interesting road names include: Gerrard Avenue (after Dr.Gerrard), Beasley Close (after Sir Gordon Beasley), Demage Drive (changed from the original Dangerous Meadow).
